name: PCC / PDC
description: Oxidizes alcohols to carbonyls. Mild and selective.

game_logic.mechanism_note: Stops at the aldehyde stage. Does not affect C=C double bonds.

hint: The Gentle Touch. Stops at the aldehyde. Won't touch double bonds.
exception: Cannot oxidize Aldehyde to Acid.

name: KMnO4 (Acidic/Heat)
description: Strong oxidation. Cleaves C=C bonds and oxidizes alcohols/aldehydes fully.

game_logic.mechanism_note: Vigorous oxidation. Ruptures carbon chains at double bonds.

hint: The Sledgehammer. If you see a double bond or benzylic H, it breaks/oxidizes to -COOH.
exception: Explodes rings. Benzylic H must be present for alkyl benzene oxidation.

name: KMnO4 (Cold, Dilute) (Baeyer’s)
description: Mild oxidation of alkenes to vicinal diols.

game_logic.mechanism_note: Syn-hydroxylation. Purple color disappears (Test for unsaturation).

hint: The Purple Test. Adds two OH groups. Syn-addition.
exception: Does not break the sigma bond of the alkene.

name: MnO2
description: Selectively oxidizes allylic and benzylic alcohols.

game_logic.mechanism_note: radical mechanism preference for stable conjugated positions.

hint: The Sniper. Only works if the OH is next to a double bond or benzene ring.
exception: Ignores normal 1-degree / 2-degree alcohols completely.

name: O3 / Zn, H2O
description: Reductive Ozonolysis. Cleaves double bonds to carbonyls.

game_logic.mechanism_note: Breaks both Sigma and Pi bonds of C=C.

hint: The Scissor. Draw a line through the double bond and put 'O' on cut ends.
exception: Keeps Aldehydes alive (doesn't over-oxidize to acids).

name: HIO4 (Periodic Acid)
description: Cleaves vicinal diols to carbonyl compounds.
hint: The Zipper. Needs OH groups on adjacent carbons to work.
exception: If OH groups are not neighbors, this card bounces off.

name: LiAlH4 (LAH)
description: Strong reducing agent. Reduces almost all carbonyls.
hint: The Nuke. Reduces everything except isolated C=C double bonds.
exception: Dangerous! Reacts violently with water/alcohol. Does not reduce isolated C=C.

name: NaBH4
description: Mild reducing agent. Selective for Aldehydes/Ketones.
hint: The Smart Bomb. Won't touch Esters, Acids, or Amides.
exception: Ignores Esters completely.

name: DIBAL-H
description: Selective reduction of Esters/Nitriles to Aldehydes (at low temp).
hint: The Freezer. The only reliable way to stop an Ester at the Aldehyde stage.
exception: Must be at -78°C. At room temp, it reduces fully to Alcohol.

name: H2 / Pd-BaSO4 (Lindlar’s)
description: Partial hydrogenation of Alkynes to Alkenes.
hint: The Half-Step. Stops at the alkene. Cis-selective.
exception: Rosenmund Reduction: Also turns Acid Chloride to Aldehyde.

name: Na / Liq. NH3 (Birch)
description: Dissolving metal reduction. Alkyne to Trans-Alkene.
hint: The Trans-Former. Anti-addition. Also affects benzene rings.
exception: Does not work on Terminal Alkynes (forms acidic salt instead).

name: Zn-Hg / HCl (Clemmensen)
description: Reduces Carbonyl (C=O) to Methylene (CH2).
hint: The Eraser. Deletes the oxygen. Acidic medium.
exception: Fails if acid-sensitive groups (like -OH or C=C) are present.

name: NH2NH2 / KOH (Wolff-Kishner)
description: Reduces Carbonyl (C=O) to Methylene (CH2).
hint: The Eraser 2.0. Basic medium. Use this if Clemmensen is unsafe.
exception: Fails if base-sensitive groups (like Alkyl Halides) are present.

name: R-Mg-X (Grignard)
description: Nucleophilic addition to carbonyls.
hint: The Builder. Always look for acidic H first (it kills the reagent).
exception: Deadly: Any acidic H kills it instantly.

name: Alc. KOH / Heat
description: Dehydrohalogenation. Forms Alkenes.
hint: The Eliminator. Removes H-X. Follows Saytzeff Rule (Major = More Substituted).
exception: Without heat, aqueous KOH does Substitution (OH replaces X).

name: t-BuOK (Bulky Base)
description: Dehydrohalogenation favoring Hofmann product.

game_logic.mechanism_note: E2 Mechanism. Steric hindrance prevents Zaitsev.

hint: The Hofmann Specialist. Too fat to grab inside protons.
exception: Forms the Less Substituted alkene.

name: SOCl2 (Thionyl Chloride)
description: Converts Alcohols to Alkyl Chlorides.

game_logic.mechanism_note: SNi mechanism (Retention of configuration) if no pyridine.

hint: The Clean Swap. Best method because byproducts are gases.
exception: Retains Stereochemistry (SNi) unless Pyridine is added (then Inversion).

name: Lucas Reagent (HCl + ZnCl2)
description: Test for Alcohols. Converts ROH to RCl.
hint: The Turbidity Test. 3-degree = Instant. 1-degree = No reaction.
exception: Primary alcohols do not react at room temp.

name: NBS (hv / Peroxide)
description: Allylic or Benzylic Bromination.
hint: The Radical Swap. Replaces H next to double bond with Br.
exception: If no light/peroxide, it might act as a simple Br2 source (Electrophilic Addition).

name: NaOH + X2 (Haloform)
description: Oxidizes Methyl Ketones to Carboxylate + CHX3.
hint: The Yellow Precipitate (if I2). Needs CH3-C=O or CH3-CH-OH.
exception: Specific to Methyl Ketones/Alcohols.

name: Dilute NaOH (Aldol)
description: Condensation of Aldehydes/Ketones with alpha-H.
hint: The Doubler. Connects two molecules. Needs Alpha-Hydrogens.
exception: Heating leads to dehydration (Alpha-Beta unsaturated product).

name: Conc. NaOH (Cannizzaro)
description: Disproportionation of Aldehydes with NO alpha-H.
hint: The Self-Redox. One molecule oxidizes, one reduces.
exception: Fails if Alpha-Hydrogens are present (does Aldol instead).
